trans-unit.source: Distribute a game
trans-unit.target: Distribute a game

trans-unit.source: When you're ready to publish your game, create a release build from Visual Studio, then distribute it.
trans-unit.target: When you're ready to publish your game, create a release build from Visual Studio, then distribute it.

trans-unit.source: 1. Create a release build
trans-unit.target: 1. Create a release build

trans-unit.source: If you've built your game in Release mode before, in your project folder (eg MyGame/Bin/MyPlatform/Release/), delete the Data folder. This folder might contain unnecessary files, such as old versions of assets, so it's simplest to build it again from scratch.
trans-unit.target: If you've built your game in Release mode before, in your project folder (eg MyGame/Bin/MyPlatform/Release/), delete the Data folder. This folder might contain unnecessary files, such as old versions of assets, so it's simplest to build it again from scratch.

trans-unit.source: Open your project in Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open your project in Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar, click the drop-down menu and select Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar, click the drop-down menu and select Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Open in VS
trans-unit.target: Open in VS

trans-unit.source: Your project opens in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Your project opens in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, from the Solution Configurations drop-down menu, select Release.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, from the Solution Configurations drop-down menu, select Release.

trans-unit.source: Select release
trans-unit.target: Select release

trans-unit.source: From the Solution platforms drop-down menu, select the platform you want to create a build for.
trans-unit.target: From the Solution platforms drop-down menu, select the platform you want to create a build for.

trans-unit.source: Select platform
trans-unit.target: Select platform

trans-unit.source: !Note
trans-unit.target: !Note

trans-unit.source: You can only build for platforms you've added to your Stride project. For instructions about how to do this, see Add or remove a platform.
trans-unit.target: You can only build for platforms you've added to your Stride project. For instructions about how to do this, see Add or remove a platform.

trans-unit.source: To build for Android or iOS, you need Xamarin, which is included with Visual Studio licenses. For instructions about how to install Xamarin with Visual Studio 2017, see this MSDN page.
trans-unit.target: To build for Android or iOS, you need Xamarin, which is included with Visual Studio licenses. For instructions about how to install Xamarin with Visual Studio 2017, see this MSDN page.

trans-unit.source: Under Build, select Build solution.
trans-unit.target: Under Build, select Build solution.

trans-unit.source: Build solution
trans-unit.target: Build solution

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio creates a release build in your project bin folder (eg MyGame/Bin/MyPlatform/Release).
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio creates a release build in your project bin folder (eg MyGame/Bin/MyPlatform/Release).

trans-unit.source: !Tip You might want to rename the Release folder to something more descriptive (such as the title of your game).
trans-unit.target: !Tip You might want to rename the Release folder to something more descriptive (such as the title of your game).

trans-unit.source: To build using terminal instead of Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: To build using terminal instead of Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: You would need to install Visual Studio to get Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio (Version)
trans-unit.target: You would need to install Visual Studio to get Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio (Version)

trans-unit.source: In Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: In Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: C:\User> msbuild PathToSln\NameOfProject.sln /p:Configuration=Release /p:OutputPath=YourPreferredPath
trans-unit.target: C:\User> msbuild PathToSln\NameOfProject.sln /p:Configuration=Release /p:OutputPath=YourPreferredPath

trans-unit.source: 2. Delete unnecessary files
trans-unit.target: 2. Delete unnecessary files

trans-unit.source: In the release folder in your project bin folder (eg MyGame/Bin/MyPlatform/Release), you can delete the following unnecessary files:
trans-unit.target: In the release folder in your project bin folder (eg MyGame/Bin/MyPlatform/Release), you can delete the following unnecessary files:

trans-unit.source: .pdb files (debug information)
trans-unit.target: .pdb files (debug information)

trans-unit.source: .xml files (API documentation)
trans-unit.target: .xml files (API documentation)

trans-unit.source: files that contain vshost in their filenames (eg MyGame.vshost.exe and MyGame5.vshost.exe.manifest)
trans-unit.target: files that contain vshost in their filenames (eg MyGame.vshost.exe and MyGame5.vshost.exe.manifest)

trans-unit.source: folders other than the x64, x86, or data folders
trans-unit.target: folders other than the x64, x86, or data folders

trans-unit.source: other unnecessary files, such as custom configuration files (ie files not created with Stride)
trans-unit.target: other unnecessary files, such as custom configuration files (ie files not created with Stride)

trans-unit.source: 3. Distribute your game
trans-unit.target: 3. Distribute your game

trans-unit.source: After you create a release build, how you distribute it is up to you.
trans-unit.target: After you create a release build, how you distribute it is up to you.

trans-unit.source: To run games made with Stride on Windows, users need:
trans-unit.target: To run games made with Stride on Windows, users need:

trans-unit.source: DirectX11 (included with Windows 10 and later), OpenGL, or Vulkan
trans-unit.target: DirectX11 (included with Windows 10 and later), OpenGL, or Vulkan

trans-unit.source: Visual C++ 2015 runtimes (x86 and/or x64, depending on what you set in your project properties in Visual Studio)
trans-unit.target: Visual C++ 2015 runtimes (x86 and/or x64, depending on what you set in your project properties in Visual Studio)

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
